title: Drawing, "Embroidered frontal"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. The left side is shown. The framing border is decorated with rinceaux. In the center is a circular panel with a cross. The circle is inscribed into a square and connected with the lateral panels which are like lozenges inscribed into oblongs. Small oblongs with figures border laterally the shown parts of the outer panels. In the lozenge is a vase with ears of grain.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Embroidered frontal".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1362.
